title: Small Firms Still Desire to Hire
sub_head: Latest NFIB employment report finds plentiful job openings, rising compensation for workers.
body:
Investors may be getting nervous about the impact of rising interest rates on economic growth and asset prices, but the owners of small U.S. firms are still eager to hire. And they’re still lifting compensation in an effort to find and retain scarce workers. That’s according to the latest monthly employment survey from the National Federation of Independent Business, due out later today.
NFIB Chief Economist William Dunkelberg reports:
